title:
Induced arithmetic removal for partition-regular patterns of complexity
  1
abstract:
In 2019, Fox, Tidor and Zhao (arXiv:1911.03427) proved an induced arithmetic
removal lemma for linear patterns of complexity 1 in vector spaces over a fixed
finite field. With no further assumptions on the pattern, this induced removal
lemma cannot guarantee a fully pattern-free recolouring of the space, as some
`non-generic' instances must necessarily remain. On the other hand,
Bhattacharyya et al. (arXiv:1212.3849) showed that in the case of
translation-invariant patterns, it is possible to obtain recolourings that
eliminate the given pattern completely, with no exceptions left behind. This
paper demonstrates that such complete removal can be achieved for all
partition-regular arithmetic patterns of complexity 1.
